intro: Oldenlandia argillacea, commonly known as the clayplant or redroot, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant typically grows in moist, clay-rich soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its small, white to pink flowers bloom in clusters and are accompanied by distinctive, leaf-like bracts. The plant is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
